name: Smart University in the IoT
body:
### About

SmartUniversity is a practical course for bachelor students of computer science and electrical engineering organized by the _Internet Technologies Research Group_ ([iNET RG](http://inet.cpt.haw-hamburg.de)) at the Hamburg University of Applied Sciences ([HAW](www.haw-hamburg.de)). The course is scheduled for the winter semester 2015/16. 

_Internet of Things_ (IoT)

[RIOT](http://riot-os.org), the friendly OS for the IoT

In the following you find further information on the designated schedule and the student projects themselves. Even more information can be found on GitHub @smartuni.

----

### Timeline and Milestones

**23.09.15 - Kick Off**

- Introduction
- Project proposals
- Tools and workflow


**09.10.15 - Milestone 1**

- Initial project specification
- Designated development timeline


**06.11.15 - Milestone 2**

- First mock-up demonstration
- Presentation at _Night of Sciences_ on Nov. 7th


**11.12.15 - Milestone 3**

- Release Candidate (RC1)
- Full working demonstration
- Review of code and documentation


**15.01.16 - Milestone 4**

- Final project presentations


----

### Projects and Groups

_Coming soon ..._

We will add details on the students projects after their initial presentation and specification on October 9th, 2015.

----

### Help and Examples

We provide some basic [examples](https://github.com/smartuni/examples) to help start developing your own IoT projects using the RIOT-OS. These examples should also serve as a template (or guide line) on how to structure source code and documentation of your projects. Take a look into the wiki of the examples repository for further details.

----

### Contact

Still questions? Feel free to contact us, see [here](http://inet.cpt.haw-hamburg.de/members).
